{{Use mdy dates|date=July 2018}} {{Infobox video game |title = Hyper Force |image = Hyper_Force,_Visual_Impact,_front.jpg |caption = Cover art in all regions by Tony Ferguson |developer = Visual Impact Productions |publisher = '''Original release'''{{vgrelease|[[North America|NA]]/[[Europe|EU]]|Computer West}} '''Relaunch'''{{vgrelease|WW|Songbird Productions}} |designer = David Govaert
Thomas Vidts |programmer = Claude Verstraeten
Kris Van Lier |artist = Kurt Huyghe
Tom Willemkens |composer = Kurt Drubbel |platforms = [[Atari Jaguar]] |released = ''Original release''{{vgrelease|[[North America|NA]]/[[Europe|EU]]|Cancelled}} ''Relaunch''{{vgrelease|WW|10 April {{vgy|2000}}}} |genre = [[Action-adventure]], [[Platform game|platform]] |modes = [[Single-player video game|Single-player]] }} '''''Hyper Force''''' is a [[side-scrolling]] [[action-adventure video game|action-adventure]] [[Platform game|platform]] [[video game]] developed by Visual Impact Productions and published by Songbird Productions exclusively for the [[Atari Jaguar]] on April 10, 2000.{{cite web|last=Smith|first=Jason|url=http://www.jaguarsector.com/index.php?autocom=ibwiki&cmd=article&do=print_article&id=379|title=Atari Jaguar Timeline|publisher=jaguarsector.com|accessdate=20 June 2018|archiveurl=https://archive.is/Qjepi|archivedate=June 29, 2013|deadurl=no}} The players take control of a lone soldier in the year 2099, where a [[megacorporation]] that has destroyed multiple planets plans to start a war against [[Earth]] if they are not stopped. Originally announced in 1994,{{cite magazine|url=http://download.abandonware.org/magazines/CD%20Consoles/cdconsoles_numero01/Page%20014.jpg|title=Actualités France - Hyper Force - Atari|magazine=CD Consoles|issue=1|publisher=Pressimage|date=November 1994|page=14|lang=fr}} ''Hyper Force'' was showcased in [[Electronic Entertainment Expo 1995|E3 1995]] but it was not released until 2000, a year after the system was declared as an [[open platform]] by [[Hasbro Interactive]] in {{vgy|1999}}.{{cite video|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fC9ZJWHFjhc|via=YouTube|date=January 18, 2011|author=QLvsJAGUAR|title=E3 1995 – first show ever! Full length documentary. Great history! (1hr 20min 50 sec)}}{{cite web|last=Henry|first=Dana|url=http://www.atari-explorer.com:80/Hasbro-PR.htm|title=Hasbro Interactive Releases Rights to the Atari Jaguar Hardware Platform|publisher=Atari Explorer|date=May 14, 1999|accessdate=11 June 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20040818111046/http://www.atari-explorer.com:80/Hasbro-PR.htm|archivedate=August 18, 2004|deadurl=no}} ''Hyper Force'' received mixed to positive reception from critics since its release, with praise towards the graphics, controls and gameplay, while the music, sound effects and technical shortcomings of the game were regarded as negative points. == Gameplay == [[File:JAG Hyper Force.png|thumb|left|Gameplay screenshot of the game. The status bar shows the score, player's health, number of lives, weapon energy and money earned.]] ''Hyper Force'' is a [[2D computer graphics|2D]], side-scrolling, action-adventure platform game which takes places on the fictional planet Terran where the player controls a lone soldier from the Interstellar Special Forces across four areas, each having a set of six levels to travel through on a mission to destroy the megacorporation Trans Con, who plans to launch a attack against [[Earth]]. Progress is manually kept by the cartridge's [[EEPROM]] by saving on either of the three slots available by pausing the game at any time and pressing Option on the controller and they are allowed to resume their last game by pressing Option at the title screen and choosing either saved slot to continue. The game cartridge also keeps [[Score (game)|high-scores]] and settings made by the player as well. Throughout the course of the game, the player fights against a variety of enemies and robots, who randomly drop power-ups, health, tech items that increase the score and money to pick up after being destroyed, with the later being used at the Interstellar Special Forces shop after finishing a level to buy new weapons and their respective upgrades, health recharge and lives, though items are also scattered in the level to pick up as well. After finishing six levels, a story cutscene is shown to progress the story. In various levels there hidden locations that contains items and other important elements introduced later in the game. Introduced in the first level are ropes that the player can hang on and traverse through the level while also shoot enemies when hanging, but players can also hang off from them by pressing down or jump from them by pressing both the jump and the shoot buttons at the same time. Also scattered through the level are obstacles such as spikes and traps, with more obstacles such as destructible blocks and colored barriers that obstruct the pathway of the player, with the later becoming more important when other colored barriers are introduced and these can be opened by finding their respective colored switch. When shooting at the enemies on the ground, players can also aim their shots by crouching or looking up. Players can also collide with enemies but they do not receive points by doing so and if they die, they are sent back to the start of the level but item pick ups are not respawned and the game is over once all lives are lost. == Plot == In the year 2099 before the start of a new century, [[Human|mankind]] has managed to expand into the [[star]]s through development of devices that allows [[interstellar travel]] possible and at a short time, with technological breaktroughs creating new levels of [[Health care|medical care]] and [[automation]] but [[megacorporation]]s have unlimited desires to expand their operations in [[outer space]], with Trans Con being the most ruthless by decimating multiple [[planet]]s and harnessing resources to break the restrains of the Terran High Command. Not wanting to lose corporative support, politicians chosed to ignore the situation, which became more delicated and as a result they turn to the Interstellar Special Forces to erradicate Trans Con and their empire, by destroying their multiple [[Headquarters|bases of operations]] and affiliated cops, guardians and soldiers without involvement of the population by sending a lone soldier from the [[special forces]], who faces the possibility of being [[disowned]] by the government if he fails in completing the task.Hyper Force game manual (Atari Jaguar, US) When the lone soldier destroys Trans Con's [[Mining#Mining industry|mining bases]] and crosses through Varmox City, he receives a message from ISF that the megacorporation has created a [[supersoldier]] after arriving at their [[Rocket garden|rocket garden fortress]] and by the time he arrives at their secret laboratories, receives another message that Trans Con is preparing to start a clone war against Earth unless he stops their scientists in the area. Although the lone soldier succeeds in stopping the scientists on the laboratories, one of the supersoldiers named the Trans Con Warrior manages to escape. After destroying it, the soldier activates a [[Self-destruct|self-destruct button]] that annihilates Trans Con alongside their empire with the lone soldier escaping from their homeworld, returning to Earth and he is honored for his work. == Development and release == ''Hyper Force'' was first previewed in 1994 on French magazine ''CD Consoles'', featuring a different graphical artstyle from the final release. Their preview article also mentioned Visual Impact working on a second project for the Jaguar, which was inspired by ''[[Doom (1993 video game)|Doom]]''. It was primarily developed in [[Belgium]].{{cite magazine|last=|first=|url=http://download.abandonware.org/magazines/CD%20Consoles/cdconsoles_numero05/Page%20076.jpg|title=Dossier - Ils Arrivent Sur Jaguar - Hyper Force/Jaguar|magazine=CD Consoles|issue=5|publisher=Pressimage|date=March 1995|page=76|lang=fr}}{{cite magazine|url=https://archive.org/stream/Edge_UK_020#page/n61/mode/2up|title=Europe: the state of play|magazine=[[Edge (magazine)|Edge]]|issue=20|date=May 1995|pages=62–67}} Internal testing reports in regards to the game from [[Atari Corporation]] indicated that many elements of the game were criticized.{{cite web|url=http://www.atarimania.com/game-atari-jaguar-hyper-force_30121.html|title=Atari Jaguar - Hyper Force|website=''atarimania.com''|accessdate=30 June 2018}} The game was showcased in a playable state at [[Electronic Entertainment Expo 1995|E3 1995]], where it was slated to be published by Computer West, who published both ''[[Cannon Fodder (video game)|Cannon Fodder]]'' and ''[[Pinball Fantasies]]'' for the Jaguar in 1995 respectively{{cite magazine|last=|first=|url=https://archive.org/stream/MANIAC.N020.1995.06/MANIAC.N020.1995.06-DURiAN_Searchable#page/n39/mode/1up|title=Feature - XT Generation Report - Atari Jaguar|magazine=[[:de:M! Games|MAN!AC]]|issue=20|publisher=Cybermedia Verlagsgesellschaft mbH|date=June 1995|page=40|lang=de}} but ''Hyper Force'' went unreleased due to the discontinuation of the Jaguar for not performing well both commercially and critically,{{cite web|url=http://contracts.onecle.com/atari/jt.mer.1996.04.08.shtml|title=Atari and JT Storage Reorganisation Plan|website= onecle.com|accessdate=2018-08-04|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20061209123854/http://contracts.onecle.com/atari/jt.mer.1996.04.08.shtml|archivedate=December 9, 2006|deadurl=no}}[http://google.brand.edgar-online.com/displayfilinginfo.aspx?FilingID=261582-33477-51099&type=sect ATARI CORP Annual Report (Regulation S-K, item 405) (10-K405) ITEM 7. MANAGEMENT'S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS] until Songbird Productions picked the rights and licensed the game from Visual Impact to release it, however, since the developer did not provided the source code of the game, it was released as it was received by the publisher.{{cite web|last=Loguidice|first=Bill|url=http://www.armchairarcade.com/neo/node/371|title=Songbird Productions: An Interview with Carl Forhan|website=''armchairarcade.com''|date=June 9, 2006|accessdate=22 June 2018}} The game was released almost a year after the system was declared as an open platform by Hasbro Interactive in 1999. == Reception == {{Video game reviews |rev1 = ''[[AllGame]]'' |rev1Score = {{Rating|2.5|5}}{{cite web|last=Games|first=Rovi|url=http://www.allgame.com/game.php?id=34904|title=Hyper Force - Overview|website=[[AllGame]]|accessdate=23 June 2018|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141114131805/http://www.allgame.com/game.php?id=34904|archivedate=November 14, 2014|deadurl=no}} |rev2 = ''The Atari Times'' |rev2Score = 73%{{cite web|last=Sherwin|first=David|url=http://www.ataritimes.com/index.php?ArticleIDX=459|title=Hyper Force - This one has hyperactive drive|website=''ataritimes.com''|date=March 28, 2005|accessdate=23 June 2018}} |rev3 = ''neXGam'' |rev3Score = 8.1 / 10{{cite web|author=Heiko|url=https://www.nexgam.de/jaguar-atari/hyper-force-atari-jaguar.html|title=Hyper Force Im Test|website=nexgam.de|date=June 27, 2013 |accessdate=23 June 2018|lang=fr}} |rev4 = ''[[:de:Video Games|Video Games]]'' |rev4Score = {{Rating|2|5}}{{cite magazine|last=Karels|first=Ralph|url=https://retrocdn.net/index.php?title=File:VideoGames_DE_2000-09.pdf&page=93|title=Jaguar-Special - Die Raubkatze Lebt! - Hyper Force|magazine=[[:de:Video Games|Video Games]]|issue=106|publisher=Future-Verlag|date=September 2000|pages=92–93|lang=de}} }} ''Hyper Force'' received mixed to positive reviews since its release. Eric Mylonas of ''[[GameFan]]'' gave a positive outlook to the game and compared it with ''[[Contra (series)|Contra]]'', praising the graphics and difficulty while criticizing the color choices in the game and limited sprite animations, remarking that "What here is good but a little more animation would have been nice".{{cite magazine|last=C. Mylonas|first=Eric|url=https://archive.org/stream/Gamefan_Vol_8_Issue_10#page/n107/mode/2up|title=The Graveyard - Hyper Force|magazine=[[GameFan]]|issue=Volume 8, Issue 10|date=October 2000|pages=104–105}} David Sherwin of ''The Atari Times'' gave positive remarks to the gameplay, controls and graphics but criticized the music, sound effects, the process of saving the game and bugs in regards to restoring the game. He summarized by saying "''Hyper Force'' doesn't bring very many new things to modern console gaming and, with its somewhat dated side-scrolling blaster action and limited graphic environments, is definitely showing its age. That being said, ''Hyper Force'' is a polished and professional effort that will provide hours of entertainment for most Jaguar gamers". == References == {{reflist|30em}} == External links == * {{Official website|http://www.songbird-productions.com/hyperforce.shtml}} * [http://www.atariage.com/software_page.html?SoftwareLabelID=1089 ''Hyper Force''] at [[AtariAge]] * [https://gamefaqs.gamespot.com/jaguar/917838-hyper-force ''Hyper Force''] at [[GameFAQs]] * [http://www.mobygames.com/game/hyper-force/ ''Hyper Force''] at [[MobyGames]] {{Portal bar|2000s|Belgium|Video games}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Hyper Force}} [[Category:2000 video games]] [[Category:Action-adventure games]] [[Category:Atari games]] [[Category:Atari Jaguar games]] [[Category:Atari Jaguar-only games]] [[Category:Platform games]] [[Category:Single-player video games]] [[Category:Songbird Productions games]] [[Category:Video games developed in Belgium]] [[Category:Video games set in the 2090s]] [[Category:Video games set on fictional planets]]

page.title: International Association of Women in Radio and Television

revision.text:
The '''International Association of Women in Radio and Television''' (IAWRT) is a women's organization involved in the [[broadcasting]] industry. [https://www.iawrt.org/about More] The organisation of professional women working in, or educating about, electronic and allied media, has a mission to strengthen initiatives which ensure women’s views and values are integral to media programming and to advance the impact of women in media.
IAWRT has consultative status with the United Nations Economic and Social Council ([[United_Nations_Economic_and_Social_Council|ECOSOC]])
==History==
IAWRT was founded in 1949 and held the first [[Academic conference|conference]] of its own in 1951.
One of the founders of the [[organization]], [[Willemijn Posthumus-van der Goot]],<ref>[http://www.iisg.nl/bwsa/bios/goot.html Willemien Hendrika (Posthumus-) van der Goot<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> left an extensive collection of papers from its early years, which are housed in the [[International Archives for the Women's Movement]] ({{lang-nl|Internationaal Informatiecentrum en Archief voor de Vrouwenbeweging (IIAV)}}), located within the [[Atria Institute on gender equality and women's history|Atria Institute]], a major women's archive based in [[Amsterdam]].<ref>[http://www.iiav.nl IIAV homepage<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
During the 1950s through 1980s, IAWRT was a friendship organization between women [[journalists]] on either side of the [[Iron Curtain]], intended to promote peace. At first, only one member from each country was permitted to join. As times changed, IAWRT became more of a networking organization for [[Mass media|media]] women, <ref>http://iawrt.org/sites/default/files/field/pdf/2014/02/Bok_IAWRT%5B1%5D.pdf</ref>
As IAWRT continued to evolve it included female digital journalists and media academics, and IAWRT began implementing media projects in various parts of the global south, supported by [[Forum_for_Women_and_Development|FOKUS]] in Norway. It has run projects and reported on [https://www.iawrt.org/sites/default/files/field/pdf/2016/08/IAWRTGenderMediaReport_2015_final_allcorr.pdf gender representation on the media] and released a free [https://www.iawrt.org/sites/default/files/field/pdf/2017/11/IAWRT%20Safety%20Manual.Download.10112017.pdf safety handbook for women journalists.] As well it has taken an increasing participatory role in the annual [[NGO_Committee_on_the_Status_of_Women,_New_York|NGO-CSW]] and [[United_Nations_Commission_on_the_Status_of_Women|CSW]] held annually around and in UN headquarters in New York, USA. [https://www.iawrt.org/news/making-it-work-gender-justice IT and Gender Justice] [https://www.iawrt.org/news/metoo-online solutions to cyber violence] were among the [https://www.iawrt.org/news/iawrt-commission-status-women62 2018 events] which IAWRT participated in.
==Current status== {{update|date=November 2010}}
The organisation today has 14 chapters across the world and continues to organise regional and international conferences, film festivals, workshops and training for the professional development of its members, including safety training. https://www.iawrt.org/events The 2016 regional conference was in Johannesburg South Africa, the 2017 biennial conference took place in Quezon City, the Philippines, the 2018 regional conference is in Entebbe, Uganda.
The President for 2017-19 is [https://www.iawrt.org/news/i-returned-my-country-stranger Violet Gonda]
The [[United Nations]] main representative is Sheila Katzman of the US, backed by [[Rebecca Myles]] and Linnea Rae, the youth representative.
==External links== {{reflist}} *[http://www.iawrt.org Official website]
{{DEFAULTSORT:International Association Of Women In Radio And Television}} [[Category:Feminist media]] [[Category:International women's organizations]] [[Category:Communications and media organizations]] [[Category:Women's occupational organizations]] [[Category:Organizations established in 1949]] [[Category:Women in radio]] [[Category:Women in television]]

revision.text:
{{multiple issues| {{notability|Companies|date=October 2013}} {{refimprove|date=February 2013}} }} {{Infobox company | name = Kalypso Media GmbH | logo = [[Image:Kalypso Media logo.png|250px|Kalypso Media logo]] | type = Games publisher & developer | foundation = 2006 | location = [[Worms, Germany|Worms]], [[Germany]] | key_people = Simon Hellwig
Stefan Marcinek | industry = [[Video game industry|Interactive entertainment]] | products = | revenue = | net_income = | EPS = | num_employees = 120+ (2011) | homepage = [http://www.kalypsomedia.com www.kalypsomedia.com] | subsid = }} '''Kalypso Media GmbH''', commonly referred to as just '''Kalypso''', is a [[Germany|German]] [[video game]] [[video game developer|developer]] and [[video game publisher|publisher]]. Founded in summer 2006 by industry veterans Simon Hellwig and Stefan Marcinek, the company has published and/or developed a number of titles such as ''[[Sins of a Solar Empire]]'',{{cite web|last=Bishop|first=Stuart|title=Sins of a Solar Empire hitting UK retail|url=http://www.computerandvideogames.com/187268/sins-of-a-solar-empire-hitting-uk-retail/|publisher=ComputerAndVideoGames}} ''[[Ceville]]'', ''[[Dungeons (video game)|Dungeons]]'', ''[[Airline Tycoon 2]]'', ''[[Boulder Dash]]'', ''[[DarkStar One]]'', ''[[Disciples (video game)|Disciples]]'', ''[[Patrician IV]]'', ''[[Tropico 3]]'', ''[[Tropico 4]]'' and ''[[Tropico 5]]''. == History == Kalypso Media was founded in summer 2006 in [[Worms, Germany|Worms]], located in the [[Frankfurt Rhine-Main]] metropolitan area. The company employs more than 120 people. Kalypso Media today has publishing offices in Germany, Great Britain and in North America and runs an online distribution network. As of March 2017, Kalypso runs two in-house development studios in Germany: *[[Realmforge Studios]], based in [[Munich]]. Developers of ''[[M.U.D. TV]]'' (2010), ''[[Dungeons (video game)|Dungeons]]'' (2011), ''[[Dark (video game)|Dark]]'' (2013), ''[[Dungeons 2]]'' (2015), and ''[[Dungeons 3]]'' (2017) *[[Gaming Minds Studios]], based in [[Gütersloh]]. Formed in 2009 with former employees of [[Ascaron]] after it went bankrupt that year and sold most of its assets to Kalypso. Developers of the Xbox 360 port of ''[[DarkStar One|Darkstar One: Broken Alliance]]'' (2010), ''[[Patrician IV]]'' (2010), ''[[Port Royale 3: Pirates & Merchants|Port Royale 3]]'' (2012), ''[[Rise of Venice]]'' (2013), ''[[Grand Ages: Medieval]]'' (2015) and ''[[Railway Empire]]'' (2018). Former studios: *[[Noumena Studios]], based in [[Berlin]]. Formed in 2010 by former [[Silver Style Entertainment]] (1993–2010) employees following the bankruptcy of their parent company TGC and Kalypso's acquiring of TCG's assets. Later renamed Skilltree Studios in 2014, and closed down in March 2016. == Notable games published == {| class="sortable wikitable" style="text-align: center" ! Release date ! Title ! Notes |- | 2019 | [[Tropico 6]] | |- | 2018 | [[Shadows: Awakening]] | |- | 2018 | [[Railway Empire]] | |- | 2017 | [[Dungeons 3]] | |- | 2017 | [[Vikings: Wolves of Midgard]] | |- | 2017 | [[Sudden Strike 4]] | |- | 2017 | [[Urban Empire]] | |- | 2015 | [[Crookz]] | |- | 2015 | [[Grand Ages: Medieval]] | |- | 2015 | [[Dungeons 2]] | |- | 2014 | [[Tropico 5]] | |- | 2013 | [[Dark (video game)|Dark]] | |- | 2013 | [[Rise of Venice]] | |- | 2013 | [[Alien Spidey]] | |- | 2013 | [[Dollar Dash]] | |- | 2013 | [[Omerta - City of Gangsters]] | |- | 2012 | [[Anna (video game)|Anna]] | |- | 2012 | [[Sine Mora]] | |- | 2012 | [[Legends of Pegasus]] | |- | 2012 | [[Hard Reset|Hard Reset: Extended Edition]] | |- | 2012 | [[Port Royale 3]] | |- | 2012 | [[Jurassic Park: The Game]] | |- | 2012 | [[Jagged Alliance (series)#Jagged Alliance: Back in Action|Jagged Alliance: Back in Action]] | |- | 2011 | [[Global Ops: Commando Libya]] | |- | 2011 | [[Airline Tycoon|Airline Tycoon II]] | |- | 2011 | [[Air Conflicts: Secret Wars]] | |- | 2011 | [[Tropico 4]] | |- | 2011 | [[Boulder Dash|Boulder Dash XL]] | |- | 2011 | [[Revolution Under Siege]] | |- | 2011 | [[Patrician IV|Patrician IV: Rise of a Dynasty]] | |- | 2011 | [[The First Templar]] | |- | 2011 | [[Elements of War]] | |- | 2011 | [[Dungeons (video game)|Dungeons]] | |- | 2011 | [[Dungeons (video game)|Dungeons - The Dark Lord]] | |- | 2010 | [[Disciples III]] | |- | 2010 | [[Pole Position 2010]] | |- | 2010 | [[DarkStar One|DarkStar One: Broken Alliance (Xbox 360)]] | |- | 2010 | [[Patrician IV|Patrician IV: Conquest by Trade]] | |- | 2010 | [[Darkfall Online|Darkfall]] | Online Distribution only |- | 2010 | [[M.U.D. TV]] | |- | 2009 | [[Tropico 3]] | |- | 2009 | [[Time of Shadows]] | |- | 2009 | [[Dawn of Magic 2]] | |- | 2009 | [[Ceville]] | |- | 2009 | [[Grand Ages: Rome]] | |- | 2008 | [[Winter Challenge 2008]] | |- | 2008 | [[AGON|AGON - The Lost Sword of Toledo]] | |- | 2008 | [[Imperium Romanum (video game)|Imperium Romanum]] | |- | 2008 | [[The Political Machine 2008|Political Machine 2008]] | |- | 2008 | [[Racing Team Manager (video game)|Racing Team Manager]] | |- | 2007 | [[Jack Keane (video game)|Jack Keane]] | |- | 2007 | [[Hollywood Pictures 2 (video game)|Hollywood Pictures 2]] | |- | 2007 | [[Campus (video game)|Campus]] | |- | 2007 | [[Star Assault (video game)|Star Assault]] | |- | 2007 | [[Theatre of War (video game)|Theatre of War]] | |} == References == {{reflist}} == External links == *{{Official website|www.kalypsomedia.com}} [[Category:Video game companies established in 2006]] [[Category:Video game companies of Germany]] [[Category:Video game development companies]] [[Category:Video game publishers]]

This is a'''list of recording artists''' who have reached number one on the singles chart in [[Finland]] since January 1996.<ref>*[http://www.finnishcharts.com/ The Official Finnish Charts on FinnishCharts.com]</ref>
[[Apulanta]] holds the record for the most number-ones songs. [[Cheek (rapper)|Cheek]] holds the record for the most number-one songs by a male artist, while [[Madonna (entertainer)|Madonna]] holds the record for a female artist.
*All acts are listed alphabetically. *Solo artists are alphabetized by last name (unless they use only their first name, e.g. Akon, listed under A), Groups by group name excluding "A," "An" and "The." {{compact ToC|num=yes}}

{{Infobox company | name = Monsoon Multimedia, Inc. | logo = Monsoonmulti1 logo.jpg | type = [[Private company|Private]] | foundation = 2004 | location = [[Noida]], India (world headquarters)
[[San Mateo, California]], United States (division)
[[Tomsk]], Russia (division){{cite web |url=http://www.monsoonmultimedia.com/contactus.html |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2008-12-23 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081220143256/http://www.monsoonmultimedia.com/contactus.html |archivedate=2008-12-20 |df= }}{{cite news| url=https://www.reuters.com/article/pressRelease/idUS218046+10-Jan-2008+PRN20080110 | work=Reuters | title=Monsoon Multimedia Announces HAVA Development Initiatives for Microsoft's Windows | date=10 January 2008}} | industry = Video Streaming and Placeshifting | products = Vulkano
HAVA line | homepage = http://www.monsoonmultimedia.com }} '''Monsoon Multimedia''' is a company that manufactures, develops and sells [[video streaming]] and [[place-shifting]] devices that allow consumers to view and control live [[television]] on [[personal computer|PC]]s connected to a local (home) network or from remotely from a [[broadband]]-connected PC or [[mobile phone]].[http://www.tvsquad.com/2007/07/02/monsoon-multimedia-launches-new-hava-video-streamers/ Monsoon Multimedia launches new HAVA video streamers] The devices enable streaming and [[Video recording|recording]] of video content from video sources including live TV, [[DVD]] players, [[video game]] consoles, and [[TiVo]] to multiple PCs wirelessly. Multiple users can connect to the HAVA from any [[Internet]] connection simultaneously with channel-changing capabilities and full operation of the video source. The devices allow a PC to operate as a [[personal video recorder]] with pause, fast forward and rewind functions. The HAVA device also works as a TV tuner for [[Windows Media Center]]-enabled PCs without being directly connected to a video source.[http://www.pcworld.com/article/id,128053-page,1-c,personalvideorecorders/article.html First Look Battle of the Placeshifting Devices] ==History== Monsoon Multimedia was created in 2004 by the founders of Dazzle and [[Emuzed]].[http://www.indusview.com/RED_HERRING___Hava_Faces_off_with_Slingbox.pdf Hava Faces off with Slingbox]{{dead link|date=February 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} HAVA's main engineering and development operations are based in [[Tomsk, Russia]] and [[New Delhi, India]]. In 1996, the founder of Monsoon Multimedia, Prabhat Jain, founded Dazzle, where he developed the PC hardware and software products to compress video based on [[MPEG]] standards. In 2000, he founded Emuzed, where Prabhat Jain created a [[TiVo]]-type product for the PC based on [[Microsoft]]'s [[Windows Media Center|Media Center]] Edition PC operating system. In November 2008, Prabhat Jain announced the appointment of consumer technology industry veteran William Loesch as CEO of the company. Loesch brought 30 years of experience in the computer software and hardware industries, primarily in the consumer digital video sector. Loesch is not currently listed on the company website as an active member of the team (11/2/2011). ==GPL and Patent lawsuits== What was claimed to be the first US lawsuit over a GPL violation concerned use of [[BusyBox]] in an embedded device. The lawsuit,[http://www.softwarefreedom.org/news/2007/sep/20/busybox/ On Behalf of BusyBox Developers Andersen and Landley, SFLC Files First Ever U.S. GPL Violation Lawsuit] (Software Freedom Law Center 20 September 2007) case 07-CV-8205 in the [[United States District Court for the Southern District of New York]] was filed on 20 September 2007 by the [[Software Freedom Law Center]] (SFLC) on behalf of the Busybox developers against Monsoon Multimedia Inc., after BusyBox code was discovered in a [[firmware]] upgrade and attempts to contact the company had apparently failed. The case was settled with release of the Monsoon version of the source and payment of an undisclosed amount of money to Andersen and Landley.[http://www.linux.com/feature/120629 Settlement reached in Busybox-Monsoon GPL case] (Bruce Byfield, Linux.com, 30 October 2007) In January 2013 [[Sling Media]] filed suit alleging infringement of five patents, against both [[Belkin International]] and Monsoon Multimedia in the [[United States District Court for the Northern District of California]].{{cite web|last1=Newton|first1=Casey|title=Sling Media sues Belkin, Monsoon for patent infringement|url=http://www.cnet.com/uk/news/sling-media-sues-belkin-monsoon-for-patent-infringement/|website=Cnet|accessdate=10 July 2014|date=8 January 2013}} The Belkin part of the suit was settled in May 2013,{{cite web|last1=Donahue|first1=Bill|title=Belkin Settles Out Of Slingbox ITC Patent Probe|url=http://www.law360.com/articles/443740/belkin-settles-out-of-slingbox-itc-patent-probe|website=[[Law360]]|publisher=LexisNexis|accessdate=10 July 2014|date=21 May 2013}} and in December 2013 the [[United States International Trade Commission]] found that Monsoon was indeed violating the patents. The commission issued cease-and-desist orders and banned the importation of Monsoon Multimedia products into the United States.{{cite web|last1=Lawson|first1=Alex|title=Video Streaming Cos. Hit With Import Bans In Slingbox Row|url=http://www.law360.com/articles/493818/video-streaming-cos-hit-with-import-bans-in-slingbox-row|website=[[Law360]]|publisher=LexisNexis|accessdate=10 July 2014|date=6 December 2013}} ==Devices== {{update section|date=July 2014}} Monsoon Multimedia's line of place-shifting devices enable multiple networked PCs within the home to simultaneously view live TV or [[Digital video recorder|DVR]] content. The number of PCs and mobile device that can connected to a single Monsoon device are limited only by the bandwidth of the network or broadband connection. Only one remote client at a time can view a place-shifted program, but the remote device can be watching while multiple home PCs watch the same program.[http://www.i4u.com/article12670.html Monsoon Announces HAVA Titanium HD] ===Vulkano=== Released in August 2010, the Vulkano adds an [[electronic program guide]] to its PC software, as well as support for [[YouTube]] video streaming on TV with an included remote control, as well as future support for [[Netflix]] and other streaming video services. Future [[Google TV]] web-browsing support is planned for 2011.[http://www.monsoonmultimedia.com/press_releases_072710.html Vulkano – World's First Universal and Affordable Video Platform for Smartphones, PC/Macs, iPads and TVs] There is also a Vulkano model that includes a 500 [[gigabyte|GB]] external hard drive for DVR recordings, which can be accessed from mobile devices. The Vulkano does not support [[Windows Media Center]] integration as the previous HAVA models did, but includes [[UPnP]] technology for photo, music, and video streaming from PCs and mobile devices. In November 2010, Monsoon added a Vulkano Platinum model, which does not include any storage drive, program guide, or recording capabilities. ===Vulkano Flow=== Announced at the 2011 [[Consumer Electronics Show]], the Vulkano Flow is a [[Mobile phone accessories|mobile accessory]]. When connected to any set-top box the Vulkano Flow can stream TV content to mobile devices inside or outside of the home. It will soon be available for $99. ===Vulkano Blast=== Also announced at the 2011 [[Consumer Electronics Show]], the Vulkano Blast integrates [[Digital video recorder|DVR]], web video, [[placeshifting]], Universal Plug and Play streaming [[UPnP]], Mobile Video Recording and 160 GB internal storage. Its approximate price is $200. ===HAVA Gold=== Controls [[digital cable]], [[satellite]], or DVR TV programming on any PC or mobile device. ===HAVA Platinum HD=== Controls [[High-definition television|high-definition]] digital cable, satellite or DVR TV programming on any PC or mobile phone. Turns a PC into [[personal video recorder]] (PVR) by recording TV shows to the hard disk or watch TV from [[Microsoft]]’s [[Windows Media Center|Media Center]] in any room within a home. The HAVA Platinum HD also includes component inputs and has ability to transmit a HD program in widescreen aspect ratio, though not in full HD resolution. The HAVA Platinum takes a 720p or 1080i signal and converts it to standard-definition resolution before streaming it over a network or over the Internet. This device also adds PC software that stores streamed content, enabling the PC or laptop to pause, rewind and fast-forward streamed content. The stored program can also be burned to [[DVD]]. ===HAVA Wireless HD=== Controls HD digital cable, satellite, or DVR programs [[wireless]]ly on any [[WiFi]]-enabled PC or mobile phone. It can stream wirelessly, DVD-quality video direct from the TV source to multiple Media Center PCs simultaneously. It can also pause, rewind, fast forward, and record live TV programs on a PC. ===HAVA Titanium HD WiFi=== Controls HD digital cable, satellite, or DVR programs wirelessly on any WiFi enabled PC or mobile phone. Streams wirelessly, DVD quality video direct from the TV source to multiple [[Windows Vista]] or Media Center PCs simultaneously. The HAVA Titanium HD adds Wi-Fi to make a wireless connection to a Wi-Fi-equipped broadband router or modem, and it features two USB ports. One is for plugging in an external USB HDD drive that can then be used as a DVR. The other USB port is for the included Wi-Fi 802.11g adapter, which sits in a cradle and is connected to a 3-foot USB cable so the adapter can be located in a spot with good reception. ==Software interface== The HAVA devices come with a HAVA Player software interface that is downloaded onto the user's PC or mobile phone. This interface enables the user to send remote control commands from their PC to their TV source.[http://tabletblog.com/2008/04/tabletblog-premiere-stream-your-home.html TabletBlog Premiere - Stream your home Satellite/Cable/DVR to your tablet with HAVA] This is done through the included wide range of virtual remote control designs.[http://www.earthtimes.org/articles/show/news_press_release,254169.shtml Monsoon Multimedia Announces HAVA Development Initiatives for Microsoft's Windows Rally Platform] The Vulkano device includes an electronic program guide (EPG) enabled software player. ==Mobile players== {{update section|date=July 2014}} ===Vulkano players=== With the release of the Vulkano in August 2010, Monsoon introduced free Vulkano players for the [[iPad]] and [[iPhone]], which only support WiFi, and not yet 3G connections. Monsoon also released an [[Android (operating system)|Android]] and [[BlackBerry]] player, and plans a future release for [[Symbian]]. ===HAVA players=== Monsoon Multimedia announced support for Windows Mobile in May 2007 enabling users to connect to the HAVA and view video content from video sources such as live TV from a [[smartphone]], [[pocket PC]] or [[PDA]].{{cite web|url=http://www.physorg.com/news98525513.html|title=Windows Mobile Devices Get HAVA Support}} In April 2008, Monsoon Media announced HAVA Player support for the [[Nokia]] [[N800]], [[N810]] and [[N810]] [[WiMax]] Internet Tablets[https://www.engadget.com/2008/04/01/hava-player-hits-nokias-internet-tablets/ HAVA player hits Nokia's internet tablets] enabling users to connect to a HAVA device to view and control video content from video sources such as live TV from a [[Nokia]] Internet Tablet. In May 2008, Monsoon Multimedia announced the HAVA Player for S60, HAVA support for Symbian S60 3rd edition mobile phones.[http://www.engadgetmobile.com/2008/05/28/hava-mobile-player-comes-to-s60-handsets/ HAVA Mobile Player comes to S60 handsets] The HAVA Player for S60 enables users to connect to a HAVA device to view and control their home TV from S60 mobile phones. In September 2009, the HAVA Player was released to the [[Apple Inc.|Apple]] [[iPhone]] and the [[iPod Touch]]. The app is free, but is not 3G-enabled. In 2018 the company disappeared; because by design all the players were using the company's central server to locate devices for remote viewing, when the server went down all Hava and Vulkano devices have become useless. The company left all device owners disappointed with no alternative solution: could have been a direct connection based on IP address without a central server like Slingbox player option. It is unknown if some knowledgeable users or anyone else was able to come up with a way to use these devices again, as the forum (hosted on the company's website) is gone too. ==See also== * [[Slingbox]] * [[LocationFree Player]] * [[HDHomeRun]] * [[Dreambox]] * [[DBox2]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://monsoonmultimedia.com MonsoonMultimedia.com] {{DEFAULTSORT:Monsoon Hava}} [[Category:Television technology]] [[Category:Television placeshifting technology]] [[Category:Companies based in Noida]] [[Category:Companies established in 2004]]

revision.comment: /* China */ hyphen not necessary, as phrase doesn't modify (an)other noun(s) as part of a noun phrase (e.g. "well-known movie star")
revision.text:
{{Redirect|Film star|the 2011 Malayalam film|The Filmstaar|the 2005 Hindi film|Film Star (film)|the Suede song|Filmstar (song)}} {{Other uses}} {{Use mdy dates|date=June 2013}}
A '''movie star''' (also known as a '''film star''' and '''cinema star''') is an actor who is [[celebrity|famous]] for their starring, or leading, roles in [[motion picture]]s.<ref>{{cite journal|last1=Albert|first1=S|title=Movie Stars and the Distribution of Financially Successful Films in the Motion Picture Industry|journal=Journal of Cultural Economics|volume=22|issue=4|pages=249–270|doi=10.1023/A:1007511817441}}</ref><ref>{{cite journal|last1=Albert|first1=S|title=Movie Stars and the Distribution of Financially Successful Films in the Motion Picture Industry|journal=Journal of Cultural Economics|volume=23|issue=4|pages=325–329|doi=10.1023/A:1007584017128}}</ref> The term is used for actors who are marketable stars and whose names are used to promote movies, for example in trailers and posters.<ref>{{cite book|last1=Shugan|first1=S|editor1-last=Moul|editor1-first=C|title=A Concise Handbook of Movie Industry Economics|date=2005|publisher=Cambridge University Press|location=Cambridge}}</ref>
==United States==
===Hollywood's early years=== [[File:Less Than the Dust 2.jpg|thumb|Poster advertising a 1916 film with [[Mary Pickford]], one of the first movie stars]] In the early days of [[silent film|silent movies]], the names of the actors and actresses appearing in them were not publicized or credited because producers feared this would result in demands for higher salaries.<ref name="100years">"[https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/films/features/100-years-of-movie-stars-19101929-1876290.html 100 years of movie stars: 1910-1929]", ''The Independent'', January 25, 2010.</ref> However, audience curiosity soon undermined this policy. By 1909, actresses such as [[Florence Lawrence]] and [[Mary Pickford]] were already widely recognized, although the public remained unaware of their names. Lawrence was referred to as the “Biograph Girl” because she worked for [[D. W. Griffith]]'s [[Biograph Studios]], while Pickford was "Little Mary." In 1910, Lawrence switched to the [[Independent Moving Pictures|Independent Moving Pictures Company]], began appearing under her own name, and was hailed as "America's foremost moving picture star" in IMP literature.<ref name="100years"/> Pickford began appearing under her own name in 1911.
The Independent Moving Pictures Company promoted their "picture personalities", including Florence Lawrence and [[King Baggot]], by giving them [[billing (filmmaking)|billing]], [[motion picture credits|credits]] and a [[marquee (sign)|marquee]]. [[promotion (marketing)|Promotion]] in advertising led to the release of stories about these personalities to newspapers and fan magazines as part of a strategy to build brand loyalty for their company's actors and films. By the 1920s, Hollywood film company promoters had developed a "massive industrial enterprise" that "...peddled a new intangible—fame."<ref name="autogenerated1">Mitchell A. Flagg, "[http://www.adidem.org/articles/MF1.html Star Crazy: Keeping The Right Of Publicity Out Of Canadian Law] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20020323005903/http://www.adidem.org/articles/MF1.html |date=March 23, 2002 }}" (1999) Ad IDEM</ref> Early Hollywood studios tightly controlled who was a movie star, as only they had the ability to place stars' names above the title; according to film historian [[Jeanine Basinger]], this was done "only for economic reasons".<ref>{{cite book|title=The Star Machine|last=Basinger|first=Jeanine|authorlink=Jeanine Basinger|publisher=[[Random House]]|year=2008|isbn=9780307491282|page=40|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=B4q1WWk9BggC&pg=PT40}}</ref>
Hollywood "image makers" and promotional agents planted rumors, selectively released real or fictitious biographical information to the press, and used other gimmicks to create [[Glamour (presentation)|glamorous]] personas for actors. Publicists thus "created" the "enduring images" and public perceptions of screen legends such as [[Judy Garland]], [[Rock Hudson]], [[Marilyn Monroe]], and [[Grace Kelly]]. The development of this "[[star system (filmmaking)|star system]]" made fame "something that could be fabricated purposely, by the masters of the new 'machinery of glory'."<ref name="autogenerated1"/> However, regardless of how "...strenuously the star and their media handlers and press agents may ... try to 'monitor' and 'shape' it, the media and the public always play a substantial part in the image-making process."<ref name="autogenerated1"/> According to Madow, "fame is a 'relational' phenomenon, something that is conferred by others. A person can, within the limits of his natural talents, make himself strong or swift or learned. But he cannot, in this same sense, make himself famous, any more than he can make himself loved."
Madow goes on to point out "fame is often conferred or withheld, just as love is, for reasons and on grounds other than 'merit'." According to Sofia Johansson the "canonical texts on stardom" include articles by Boorstin (1971), Alberoni (1972) and Dyer (1979) that examined the "representations of stars and on aspects of the Hollywood star system". Johansson writes that "more recent analyses within media and cultural studies (e.g. Gamson 1994; Marshall 1997; Giles 2000; Turner, Marshall and Bonner 2000; Rojek 2001; Turner 2004) have instead dealt with the idea of a pervasive, contemporary, '[[celebrity culture]]'." In the analysis of the celebrity culture, "fame and its constituencies are conceived of as a broader social process, connected to widespread economic, political, technological and cultural developments."<ref>[http://www.wmin.ac.uk/mad/pdf/Sofia.pdf Editorial] by Sofia Johansson from the Communication and Media Research Institute of the University of Westminster</ref>
In the 1980s and 1990s, entertainment companies began using stars for a range of publicity tactics including press releases, movie junkets, and community activities. These promotional efforts are targeted and designed using market research, to increase the predictability of success of their media ventures. In some cases, publicity agents may create “provocative advertisements” or make an outrageous public statement to trigger public controversy and thereby generate "free" news coverage.<ref name="autogenerated1" /> Movie studios employed performers under long-term contracts. They developed a star system as a means of promoting and selling their movies. "Star vehicles" were filmed to display the particular talents and appeal of the most popular movie stars of the studio.
==Asia== [[File:Sophie Marceau Zhang Ziyi Cabourg 2014 2.jpg|thumb|Two movie stars, [[Sophie Marceau]] and [[Zhang Ziyi]], respectively from [[France]] and [[China]], at the [[Cabourg Film Festival]] in June 2014.]] Movie stars in other regions too have their own star value. For instance, in [[Asian cinema|Asian film]] industries, many movies often run on the weight of the star's crowd pulling power more than any other intrinsic aspect of film making.
===China=== A number of [[Cinema of China|Chinese film]] actors have become some of the most popular movie stars in [[East Asia|Eastern Asia]], and several are also well known in the Western world. They include [[Jackie Chan]], [[Jet Li]], [[Chow Yun-fat]], [[Stephen Chow]], [[Sammo Hung]], [[Gong Li]], [[Ziyi Zhang]], [[Maggie Cheung]], and the late [[Bruce Lee]].
===India=== {{multiple image|caption_align=center|header_align=center |align = right |total_width = 340 |image1 = Amitabh Bachchan December 2013.png |width1 = 380 | height1 = 500 |image2 = Sridevi.jpg |width2 = 380 | height2 = 500 |footer = [[Amitabh Bachchan]] and [[Sridevi]], are regarded as one of the biggest and most influential movie stars of all-time.}}
The [[Cinema of India|Indian film]] industry, of which one is commonly known as [[Bollywood]], has its own set of rules in this aspect. There are often [[superstar]]s in this region who command premium pay commensurate with their [[box office]] appeal. Male Indian actors who are among the most popular movie stars in India and [[South Asia|Southern Asia]] include [[Rajesh Khanna]], [[Amitabh Bachchan]], [[Dilip Kumar]], [[Raj Kapoor]], [[Dharmendra]], [[Jeetendra]], [[Naseeruddin Shah]], [[Raj Babbar]], [[Mohanlal]], [[Amol Palekar]],[[Aamir Khan]], [[Shahrukh Khan]], [[Salman Khan]], [[Akshay Kumar]], [[Hrithik Roshan]], [[Arjun Rampal]], [[Govinda (actor)|Govinda]], [[Shahid Kapoor]] and [[Anil Kapoor]]. Actresses include [[Sridevi]], [[Shabana Azmi]], [[Smita Patil]], [[Kajol]], [[Madhuri Dixit]], [[Aishwarya Rai]], [[Katrina Kaif]], [[Kareena Kapoor]], [[Karisma Kapoor]], [[Manisha Koirala]], [[Tabu (actress)|Tabu]], [[Priyanka Chopra]], [[Preity Zinta]], [[Rani Mukerji]], [[Deepika Padukone]], [[Hema Malini]], [[Madhubala]], [[Meena Kumari]], [[Zeenat Aman]], [[Reena Roy]], [[Vyjayanthimala]], and [[Rekha]].
Some mainstream Indian movie stars, like the [[Khans of Bollywood]] ([[Aamir Khan]],<ref name="aamir">[https://www.forbes.com/sites/robcain/2017/06/11/how-to-become-a-foreign-movie-star-in-china-aamir-khans-5-point-formula-for-success/ How To Become A Foreign Movie Star In China: Aamir Khan's 5-Point Formula For Success], ''[[Forbes]]'', 11 June 2017</ref> [[Shah Rukh Khan]], [[Salman Khan]], [[Dilip Kumar]]), [[Raj Kapoor]], [[Nargis]],<ref>[https://www.calvertjournal.com/articles/show/4569/bollywood-affair-indian-cinema-USSR-raj-kapoor-nargis Bollywood affair: how Indian cinema arrived in the USSR], ''The Calvert Journal'', [[Calvert 22 Foundation]], August 2015</ref> [[Mithun Chakraborty]],<ref name="sbs">[http://www.sbs.com.au/yourlanguage/hindi/en/article/2017/03/18/do-you-remember-jimmy-jimmy Do you remember Jimmy Jimmy?], [[Special Broadcasting Service|SBS]], 18 March 2017</ref> [[Amitabh Bachchan]] and [[Aishwarya Rai]] gained international fame across [[Asia]]<ref>{{cite web|title=Budding romance: Bollywood in China|author= Dr. Sudha Ramachandran|publisher=[[Asia Times]]|date=2 June 2015|url=http://atimes.com/2015/06/budding-romance-bollywood-in-china/}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Lagaan revives memories of Raj Kapoor in China|author=Anil K. Joseph|publisher=[[Press Trust of India]]|date=20 November 2002|url=http://www.expressindia.com/news/fullstory.php?newsid=16983|accessdate=30 January 2009|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6AC5TaOD8?url=http://www.expressindia.com/news/fullstory.php?newsid=16983|archivedate=August 26, 2012|df=mdy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Rahman's 'Lagaan' cast a spell on me|publisher=[[Sify]]|date=13 February 2004|url=http://sify.com/peopleandplaces/fullstory.php?id=13388284|accessdate=24 February 2009|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090324022050/http://sify.com/peopleandplaces/fullstory.php?id=13388284|archivedate=March 24, 2009|df=mdy-all}}</ref> and [[Eastern Europe]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.russiatoday.ru/features/news/11895 |title=RussiaToday : Features: Bollywood challenges Hollywood in Russia |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080626020120/http://www.russiatoday.ru/features/news/11895 |archivedate=26 June 2008 |df=dmy }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.chillibreeze.com/articles/Indian-films.asp |title=Promoting Bollywood Abroad Will Help to Promote India |last=Ashreena |first=Tanya |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131203003948/http://www.chillibreeze.com/articles/Indian-films.asp |archivedate=3 December 2013 |df=dmy }}</ref> For example, [[Bollywood]] films were [[List of Soviet films of the year by ticket sales|popular in the Soviet Union]], more so than [[Cinema of the United States|Hollywood films]]<ref>[https://books.google.com/books?id=cpoLAQAAMAAJ ''Indian Films in Soviet Cinemas: The Culture of Movie-going After Stalin''], page 75, [[Indiana University Press]], 2005</ref> and occasionally even domestic [[Soviet films]].<ref>[https://books.google.com/books?id=laoaAQAAIAAJ ''Behind The Scenes Of Hindi Cinema: A Visual Journey Through The Heart Of Bollywood''], page 138, [[Royal Tropical Institute]], 2005</ref> Indian actors like Raj Kapoor, Nargis<ref name="hindu_russia">{{cite news|title=Bollywood re-enters Russian homes via cable TV|work=[[The Hindu]]|date=27 September 2007|url=http://www.hindu.com/thehindu/holnus/009200709270360.htm|accessdate=7 June 2011|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121109235938/http://www.hindu.com/thehindu/holnus/009200709270360.htm|archivedate=9 November 2012|location=Chennai, India}}</ref> and Mithun Chakroborty were household names in the Soviet Union,<ref name="sbs"/> with films such as ''[[Awaara]]'' (1951) and ''[[Disco Dancer]]'' (1982) drawing more than 60 million viewers in the country.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://kinanet.livejournal.com/13882.html|title=Зарубежные фильмы в советском кинопрокате|author=[[Sergey Kudryavtsev (film critic)|Sergey Kudryavtsev]]}}</ref><ref name="hindu_russia"/> The [[Hindi film]] actors Raj Kapoor<ref name="firstpost"/> and Aamir Khan also became very popular in China, with films such as ''Awaara'', ''[[3 Idiots]]'' (2009), and ''[[Dangal (film)|Dangal]]'' (2016),<ref name="aamir"/><ref name="firstpost">{{cite web |last=Chintamani |first=Gautam |title=Dangal in China: How Aamir Khan became India's most popular export to the land of the dragon |url=http://www.firstpost.com/entertainment/dangal-in-china-how-aamir-khan-became-indias-most-popular-export-across-the-great-wall-3460692.html |date=20 May 2017 |website=[[Firstpost]] |access-date=13 June 2018}}</ref> one of the top 20 [[List of highest-grossing films in China|highest-grossing films in China]].<ref name="forbes9">[https://www.forbes.com/sites/robcain/2017/06/09/dangal-makes-history-in-china-by-joining-list-of-all-time-20-biggest-box-office-hits/ 'Dangal' Makes More History In China, Joins List Of All-Time 20 Biggest Box Office Hits], ''[[Forbes]]'', 9 June 2017</ref>
===Southeast-Asian archipelago===
The film industry of the Malay Archipelago (also known as [[Nusantara]]) consists primarily of film industries in [[Malaysia]], [[Indonesia]], the [[Philippines]], and [[Singapore]]. Over the past century, these four cinemas have collaborated on a number of projects. A number of actors from this region have become some of the most sought-after movie stars in southeast Asia, commonly in [[Malay language|Malay]]-speaking countries.
Actors such as [[P. Ramlee]], Rano Karno, [[Rima Melati]], [[Deddy Mizwar]], Jins Shamsuddin, Eman Manan, Alex Komang, [[Christine Hakim]], Fauziah Ahmad Daud, [[Nora Aunor]], [[Joseph Estrada]], [[José Padilla, Jr.|Jose Padilla]], Nordin Ahmad, [[Saadiah]], [[Fernando Poe Jr.]], [[Roy Marten]], and [[Yusof Haslam]] are considered movie stars of the 20th century, some of them having acted in all four countries.
Other, more recent movie stars include Romalis Syafril, [[Erra Fazira]], [[Rosyam Nor]], [[Shaheizy Sam]] and [[Maya Karin]], from Malaysia; [[Nicholas Saputra]], Vino G. Bastian, [[Dian Sastrowardoyo]], [[Tora Sudiro]], and [[Iko Uwais]], from Indonesia; Claudine Baretto, [[Piolo Pascual]], [[John Lloyd Cruz]], [[Jericho Rosales]], [[Aga Muhlach]], Kristine Hermosa, [[Dingdong Dantes]], and [[Bea Alonzo]], from the Philippines; and a few from Singapore, such as [[Aaron Aziz]] and Adi Putra.

{{EngvarB|date=November 2017}} {{Use dmy dates|date=August 2018}} {{Infobox broadcasting network | name = '''NOW TV''' | former_names = | logo = Now TV (Sky plc) logo.svg | image = | type = [[Subsidiary]] | founded = {{start date and age|2012|7|17|df=yes}} | country = [[United Kingdom]], [[Republic of Ireland]], and [[Italy]] | broadcast_area = | headquarters = '''UK:''' Athena Court, Grant Way, [[Isleworth]], [[Middlesex]], TW7 5QD<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://beta.companieshouse.gov.uk/company/09158142|title=NOW TV LIMITED - Overview (free company information from Companies House)|website=beta.companieshouse.gov.uk|language=en|access-date=19 November 2017}}</ref>
'''Ireland:''' Fifth Floor, One Burlington Plaza, Burlington Road, [[Dublin]] 4 D04 RH96<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.solocheck.ie/Irish-Company/Sky-Ireland-Limited-547787|title=Sky Ireland Ltd {{!}} Irish Legal & Business Services Company & Director Check|website=www.solocheck.ie|language=en|access-date=30 March 2018}}</ref>
'''Italy:''' Via Monte Penice No. 7 [[Milan]], MI 20138<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://it.kompass.com/c/sky-italia-srl/it0096399/|title=Sky Italia, Srl - Milano 20138 (Milano), Via Monte Penice 7 , CF (CODICE FISCALE) 04619241005|website=it.kompass.com|language=it|access-date=30 March 2018}}</ref> | keypeople = | available = [[Internet Television|Internet]] | slogan = | parent = '''[[Sky Limited|Sky]]:'''
*[[Sky UK Limited]] *[[Sky Ireland|Sky Ireland Limited]] *[[Sky Italia|Sky Italia S.r.l.]] | website = '''UK:''' {{URL|http://www.nowtv.com}}
'''Ireland:''' {{URL|http://www.nowtv.com/ie}}
'''Italy:''' {{URL|http://www.nowtv.it}}}}
'''Now TV''' (presented as '''NOW TV''') is a telecommunications company with operations in the [[United Kingdom]], [[Republic of Ireland]], and [[Italy]]. Now TV provides contract-free [[Subscription business model|subscription]] [[internet television]], [[Broadband#Internet broadband|broadband internet]], and [[Landline|landline telephone]] services. The majority of services available by Now TV are designed to cater for consumers who do not want to be tied to a contract.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.sky.com/story/961107/no-dish-no-contract-sky-launches-now-tv|title=No Dish, No Contract - Sky Launches Now TV|last=Stallard|first=Katie|date=17 July 2012|publisher=News.sky.com|accessdate=15 April 2014}}</ref>
Now TV was first announced in the UK in February 2012 as an internet television service, and launched on 17 July 2012 originally offering a [[Sky Cinema]] subscription; from March 2013 offering a [[Sky Sports]] television channels subscription;<ref>{{cite web|url=http://corporate.sky.com/media/press_releases/2013/pay_as_you_go_sky_sports_comes_to_now_tv|title=Pay-as-you-go Sky Sports comes to Now TV|date=19 March 2013|publisher=Corporate.sky.com|accessdate=15 April 2014}}</ref> from October 2013 offering an entertainment television channels subscription;<ref>{{cite web|url=http://corporate.sky.com/media/press_releases/2012/nows_the_time_for_now_tv |title=BSkyB Corporate | Now's the time for Now TV |publisher=Corporate.sky.com |date=16 July 2012 |accessdate=15 April 2014}}</ref> from June 2016 offering a children's television channels subscription.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://community.nowtv.com/t5/Kids/The-Now-TV-Kids-Pass-Coming-June-21/ba-p/369971#24B7BfzuuDLJCS96.97|title=The Now TV Kids Pass: Coming June 21!|date=4 May 2016|access-date=3 November 2017|language=en}}</ref> On 24 June 2016 the Now TV internet television service was launched in Italy.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.digital-news.it/news/sky-italia/42216/nowtv-arriva-in-italia-ecco-tutti-i-dettagli-della-nuova-internet-tv-di-sky|title=NowTv arriva in Italia, ecco tutti i dettagli della nuova Internet TV di Sky - Digital-News|date=23 June 2016|work=Digital News|access-date=13 April 2018|language=it-IT}}</ref> On 29 June 2016, Now Broadband was launched in the UK.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.ispreview.co.uk/index.php/2016/06/skys-now-tv-launches-no-contract-bundle-broadband-phone.html|title=UPD Sky's NOW TV Launch No Contract Bundle with Broadband and Calls - ISPreview UK|last=Jackson|first=Mark|website=www.ispreview.co.uk|access-date=19 November 2017}}</ref> On 26 April 2017 the Now TV internet television service was launched in the Republic of Ireland.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.irishtimes.com/business/media-and-marketing/sky-brings-now-tv-on-demand-service-to-ireland-1.3061851|title=Sky brings Now TV on-demand service to Ireland|work=The Irish Times|access-date=12 November 2017|language=en-US}}</ref> From July 2018 Now TV started offering a [[Hayu (subscription service)|Hayu]] [[video on demand]] subscription.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.a516digital.com/2018/07/now-tv-launches-new-hayu-pass.html|title=Now TV launches new hayu pass|work=a516digital|access-date=2018-11-23}}</ref> Now Broadband is not currently available in Ireland or Italy with no future plans announced.
==Accessing Now TV television content== Television content is available on a number of different platforms providing access via big screen and small screen [[mobile device]]s.<ref name="NowTVSupportedDevices">{{cite web| url=http://help.nowtv.com/article/Supported-devices |title=Supported Devices for Now TV |publisher=Now TV |accessdate=26 April 2016}}</ref> In the UK, Ireland and Italy four devices can be registered onto one Now TV account. In the UK and Ireland two devices can stream Now TV content at the same time as standard;<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.nowtv.com/devices|title=Watch Now TV instantly on over 60 Devices|website=@NowTV|language=en-gb|access-date=30 October 2017}}</ref> in Italy this is possible by subscribing to the "Option +" subscription.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.nowtv.it/assistenza/index.shtml?parametro=/assistenza_faq_detail?id=kA0b0000000f7dt|title=Assistenza, faq e contatti {{!}} NowTV|website=www.nowtv.it|language=it|access-date=13 April 2018}}</ref> The service currently offers streaming of up to [[720p]] resolution depending on the playback device and uses [[adaptive bitrate streaming]] to minimise disruption.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://help.nowtv.com/article/Streaming-Quality|title=What's the highest streaming quality for my device?|website=Help.nowtv.com|accessdate=13 November 2017}}</ref> In January 2018 Now TV in the UK and Ireland announced that by the end of 2018 consumers will be able to stream Now TV television content in [[1080p]] resolution on all playback devices supporting that resolution. 720p live streaming and 1080p [[video on demand]] content is offered on Now TV in Italy as an optional extra subscription. In January 2018 Now TV in the UK and Ireland announced that consumers will be able to download on demand content on their mobile devices for offline access to content while on the go and/or for smoother playback for those with slower internet connections: this feature will start being rolled out during spring 2018.<ref name="Sky Corporate">{{Cite web|url=https://www.skygroup.sky/corporate/media-centre/articles/en-gb/NOW-TV-launches-UKs-cheapest-TV-Smart-Stick|title=Sky Corporate|website=Sky|language=en-GB|access-date=26 January 2018}}</ref>

=== Now TV proprietary devices === Four propriety Now TV boxes and one proprietary streaming stick have been launched. The Now TV "White" Box is no longer officially available as it is succeeded by the Now TV "Black" Box. All of the Now TV boxes and the Now TV Streaming Stick provide access to live television channel [[Streaming media|streams]] and video on demand content courtesy of the available Entertainment, [[Sky Cinema]], [[Sky Sports]], and Kids Passes. There is limited access to the Roku Channel Store in which an approved list of [[application software]] can be downloaded such as [[BBC iPlayer]], [[ITV Hub]], [[All 4]], [[My5]], [[Sky Box Office|Sky Sports Box Office]] and the [[Sky News|Sky Store]]. Users were able to side-load apps via developer mode, but this was disabled by Sky in March 2017.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.engadget.com/2017/03/16/now-tv-update-kills-plex/|title=A sly Now TV update is culling sideloaded apps like Plex|work=Engadget|access-date=25 June 2018|language=en-US}}</ref>
In July 2013 Now TV launched the Now TV "white" box (based on the 2011 [[Roku#Feature comparison|Roku LT]]) allowing consumers when connected to [[Wi-Fi]] to stream Now TV content to their television via an [[Analog signal|analogue]] audio/video output or an [[HDMI]] connection capable of outputting up to 720p video resolution.<ref>{{cite web|last=Lawler |first=Richard |url=https://www.engadget.com/2013/07/26/sky-now-tv-box-9-99/ |title=Sky's Now TV box is a £9.99 Roku clone that streams iPlayer and more |publisher=Engadget.com |date= |accessdate=15 April 2014}}</ref>
In August 2015 Now TV launched the Now TV "black" Box (based on the 2015 [[Roku#Feature comparison|Roku 2]]). It offers the same user interface as the original Now TV "white" box, but with updated technical specifications such as a higher performance [[Central processing unit|CPU]], an [[Ethernet]] port (in addition to Wi-Fi), a [[USB]] port (not currently functional), a [[Secure Digital#Mini- and micro-cards|microSD card]] slot (not currently functional), the capability of outputting up to 1080p video resolution via an HDMI connection.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.pocket-lint.com/news/134825-now-tv-box-2015-vs-now-tv-box-vs-roku-2-what-s-the-difference|title=Now TV Box (2015) vs Now TV Box vs Roku 2: What's the difference? - Pocket-lint|website=Pocket-lint.com}}</ref>. It does not have an analogue audio/video output connection like its "white" box predecessor. The Now TV "black" Box is currently the only Now TV device available in Ireland and Italy.
In July 2016 Now TV launched the first generation Now TV Smart Box (based on the 2015 [[Roku#Feature comparison|Roku 4]]) providing the same access as previous boxes, but with updated technical specifications, such as a higher performance CPU and an internal [[DVB-T]]/[[DVB-T2]] [[Digital terrestrial television|digital terrestrial television tuner]] giving the ability to access [[Freeview (UK)|Freeview]] and [[Freeview HD]] television channels that can be paused and rewound up to 30 minutes. Red Button and interactive services are accessible by pressing the asterisk ('''✱''') button on the Now TV remote control.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nowtv.com/tv-boxes|title=Now TV Boxes - find out about our media streaming boxes|website=@NowTV}}</ref>
In February 2018 Now TV launched the Now TV Smart Stick (based on the 2017 [[Roku#Feature comparison|Roku Streaming Stick]]). It is quick and easy to plug it into any display with an HDMI port and offers plug and play portability. The Now TV "Smart Stick" is the first Now TV device to include a [[Wi-Fi|Wi-Fi Direct]] [[remote control]] with [[voice search]] allowing users to search movies and shows by name, or by favourite actors or directors, by talking into the "Smart Stick" remote. Apps can also be launched via voice search by users saying the name of the app they wish to launch. The Now TV "Smart Stick" has a feature called "Hotel connect" which allows users to connect to Wi-Fi networks that require signing in to the Wi-Fi network through a web browser.
In September 2018 Now TV launched the second generation Now TV Smart Box (Based around the 2016 [[Roku#Feature comparison|Roku Premiere+]]). The second generation Smart box is much smaller in size compared to it's original predecessor mainly due to the removal of the internal [[DVB-T]]/[[DVB-T2]] [[Digital terrestrial television|digital terrestrial television tuner]] that gave it the ability to access Freeview and Freeview HD television channels. The new Smart box features the same [[Wi-Fi|Wi-Fi Direct]] [[remote control]] with [[voice search]] that is included with the Now TV Smart Stick. The new Smart Box is capable of outputting at up to [[4K resolution|2160p]] (4K) at [[Frames per second|60fps]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.ispreview.co.uk/index.php/2018/09/now-tv-launch-new-smart-box-with-4k-ultrahd-and-voice-search.html|title=NOW TV Launch New Smart Box with 4K UltraHD and Voice Search - ISPreview UK|last=Jackson|first=Mark|website=www.ispreview.co.uk|access-date=2018-09-30}}</ref>

=== Now TV television content === Now TV offers four ''channel packages''<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.cable.co.uk/providers/now-broadband/|title=NOW Broadband Packages|website=cable.co.uk|language=en|access-date=21 August 2018}}</ref> in the UK, three channel packages in Ireland, and four channel packages in Italy, all providing live streaming and video on demand.
==== Now TV television content in the UK and Ireland ==== The subscriptions in both the UK and Ireland are branded as "Now TV Passes": Entertainment Pass, [[Sky Cinema]] Pass, [[Sky Sports]] Pass, [[Sky Sports]] Mobile Pass, a Kids Pass, and a [[Hayu (subscription service)|hayu]] Pass<ref name="Filmoria">{{cite web |url=https://www.filmoria.co.uk/new-content-on-now-tv-this-september/|title=Hayu Pass - New Content on NOW TV|publisher=''Filmoria.co.uk''|date= |accessdate=28 August 2018}}</ref> (The "White" Now TV box does not support the hayu pass). On 5 December 2017 live streaming and video on demand of television channel [[Syfy (UK and Ireland)|Syfy]] was added as part of the Entertainment Month Pass in the UK and Ireland.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.ispreview.co.uk/index.php/2017/12/now-tv-add-syfy-channel-uk-broadband-video-streaming-service.html|title=NOW TV Add SyFy Channel to UK Broadband Video Streaming Service - ISPreview UK|last=Jackson|first=Mark|website=www.ispreview.co.uk|access-date=7 December 2017}}</ref> Some programmes may not be available for live streaming due to licensing rights and legal restrictions.

==== Now TV television content in Italy ==== The subscriptions in Italy are branded as "Now TV Tickets": Entertainment Ticket, Series TV Ticket, Cinema Ticket, and Sports Ticket. Tickets are offered within two main subscription packages: Now TV Mobile and Now TV All Screens. The monthly Now TV Mobile subscription includes Entertainment and Series TV tickets that can be used to watch on tablets and smartphones. The Sky Sport Ticket is not available to use on tablets and smartphones. The Now TV All Screens subscription offers a choice of one ticket alone (any one excluding Sky Sports), two tickets (any two excluding Sky Sports), or three tickets (any three excluding Sky Sports). When subscribed to the Entertainment, Series TV, and/or Sky Cinema tickets an additional monthly subscription is available to consumers to receive 720p live streaming and 1080p video on demand content, allowing up to two devices at the same time.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.nowtv.it/offerta/index.shtml|title=Abbonamento, prezzi e offerte {{!}} NOW TV|website=www.nowtv.it|access-date=6 April 2018}}</ref> Some programmes may not be available for live streaming due to licensing rights and legal restrictions. By using the Now TV app, Now TV Tickets that have already been subscribed to and made active while within Italy can be accessed in the same way for up to 37 days at a time in other countries that are members of the [[European Union]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.nowtv.it/assistenza/index.shtml?parametro=/assistenza_faq_detail?id=kA00X000000UPUm|title=Assistenza, faq e contatti {{!}} NowTV|website=www.nowtv.it|language=it|access-date=16 April 2018}}</ref>

== Now Broadband == [[File:Now Broadband logo.png|thumb|459x459px|Now Broadband logo]] Now Broadband includes unlimited [[broadband#Internet broadband|broadband internet]] with a choice of three different options: up to 17 Mbit/s [[Cable Internet access|cable]] broadband (marketed as "Brilliant Broadband"); up to 38 Mbit/s [[Fiber-optic communication|fibre-optic]] broadband (marketed as "Fab Fibre"); or up to 76 Mbit/s fibre-optic broadband (marketed as "Super Fibre"). Now Broadband includes a landline telephone service with a choice of either pay-as-you-go calls (no monthly charge); unlimited calls to UK landlines and mobile numbers on weekday evenings and all day Saturday and Sunday; or 24/7 unlimited calls to UK landline and mobile numbers. Now Broadband is offered either without a contract or a 12 month contract to reduce costs. Now Broadband is only available in the UK, but not in Ireland or Italy.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.nowtv.com/broadband|title=NOW TV Broadband - Unlimited Home Broadband Provider|website=@NOWTV|language=en-gb|access-date=1 March 2018}}</ref>
=== Now Broadband Hubs === All Now Broadband packages currently include a [[Router (computing)|router]] marketed as the "Now Broadband Hub Two". The "Now Broadband Hub Two" (NR801) is a re-branded [[Sky UK|Sky]] Q Hub (ER115) and is of the [[IEEE 802.11ac|Wireless-AC]] standard, using [[ISM band]] 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz frequencies. The original "Now Broadband Hub" (NR102) is a re-branded [[Sky UK|Sky]] Hub 2 (SR102) and is of the [[IEEE 802.11n-2009|Wireless-N]] standard, using the 2.4 GHz frequency. The use of other routers is possible but Now Broadband does not provide support for third party equipment.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://community.nowtv.com/t5/NOW-TV-Combo/Hub-specifications/td-p/412045|title=Hub specifications|date=20 December 2016|access-date=19 November 2017|language=en}}</ref> {| class="wikitable" |+ ! !Now Broadband Hub<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://help.nowtv.com/article/choose-your-hub|title=How do I set up my NOW Broadband Hub?|access-date=11 July 2018|language=en}}</ref> !Now Broadband Hub Two<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://help.nowtv.com/article/choose-your-hub|title=How do I set up my NOW Broadband Hub?|access-date=11 July 2018|language=en}}</ref> |- !Model Number(s) |NR102 |NR801<ref>https://www.engadget.com/2018/01/25/now-tv-combo-home-broadband-packages/ Model number is depicted in the picture of the hub two</ref> |- !Availability |Officially available and supported |Officially available and supported |- !Wi-Fi Standards |Single-band [[Wi-Fi#IEEE 802.11 standard|802.11n]] |Dual-band [[Wi-Fi#IEEE 802.11 standard|802.11ac]] |- !2.4 GHz frequency support |Yes |Yes |- !5 GHz frequency support |No |Yes |- ![[Ethernet|Ethernet ports]] |4x [[Fast Ethernet#100BASE-TX|100BASE-TX]] |2x [[Gigabit Ethernet#1000BASE-T|1000BASE-T]] |}
=== Now Broadband Buddy === All Now Broadband customers have access to free internet protection with a site filter marketed as "Broadband Buddy", designed to keep consumers safe while online on any device connected to the internet through Now Broadband. There are three age rating settings: "PG" which only allows web browsing suitable for everyone; "13" which allows only web browsing suitable for teens and older; and "18" which only allows web browsing suitable for adults. Consumers who want custom protection can manually allow or block access to specific websites or website categories and can also set Now "Broadband Buddy" to automatically change the 18 age rating setting on and off at a particular time of each day. Both phishing and malware protection is available to prevent the collection of private information without permission while browsing the internet, and to prevent viruses infecting any devices in use.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://help.nowtv.com/article/What-is-Broadband-Buddy|title=What is NOW TV Broadband Buddy?|website=help.nowtv.com|language=en|access-date=5 December 2017}}</ref>
